content:
Add an Event Listener to a FlexCard

You want to create a Lightning page that displays a filterable list of products. To do this, you need two FlexCards: one that triggers an event and another that listens for the event and executes an action.

Create a Custom or Pubsub event. In the FlexCard Designer, click Setup to open the Setup panel. Click + Add New in the Event Listener section. Select a Custom or Pubsub Event Type.

Configure a Custom event by entering the name of the event, such as reloadCard. To register dynamic events based on a parent attribute or a session variable, enter an event name with {Parent.attr}, {recordId}, or {Session.var} context variables.

To configure a PubSub event:

Enter the channel in which the event is posted. Beginning Winter '22, Channel Name supports registering dynamic events based on the {recordId}. Enter a channel name such as productViewCard_{recordId}.

Beginning Spring '22, to register dynamic events based on a parent attribute or a session variable, enter a channel name with {Parent.attr} (on a child FlexCard only) and {Session.var} context variables.

Enter the name of the event, such as reloadCard. If your action type is Card, and type is remove, update the index to indicate which record to remove.

To create the action:

Select an Action Type from the dropdown. Configure the selected Action Type. Beginning Winter '22, add conditions to execute the action depending on the value of a data field.

Click Save. Beginning Winter '22, execute sequential actions from an event listener.
title: Adding an Event Listener to a FlexCard in OmniStudio
